src\\components\\atoms\\AlertText\\Alert.documentation:
Status: in progress.

Use this component when you want to make the user aware of something, for instance:

  • the chat to customer service is closed
  • unpaid amount on invoice if date is past due date

It's recommended to use this component with any heading component and only for short texts (for instance maximum five words).

examples.html: Chat is closed
examples.name: AlertText (default)

src\\components\\atoms\\FullWidthTable\\.documentation:
Status: finished.

This table component use negative margins to achieve full width rows in the table, and padding to add back the negative margin value. To avoid horizontal scrolling it is important to style the nearest full width element with overflow-x: hidden;.

It's also recommended to use this component within an element with a styling that centers-, and sets the content to a max-width.

The css-class .horizontal-ruler can be used on any element to give it a grey border in bottom of the element, or it can be used on the <hr/> tag as a standalone component. The style should be used to define a thematic break.

src\\components\\atoms\\PagePebbles\\Pag.documentation:
Status: finished.

Use the CSS class .page-pebbles if you want pebbles as decoration on your page. This applies to devices wider than or equal to 900px.

If you want another pattern of the pebbles, add a second class like this: .page-pebbles .page-pebbles--variation-1. There are five variation classes with numbers from 1-5 that you can choose between.

The pebble decoration is safe to use- and will not overlap the page content when you have it wrapped inside .body-text-container or content is of similar or smaller width.

examples.name: PagePebbles (default)

src\\components\\molecules\\FullWidthIma.documentation:
Status: finished.

Recommendations from designers:

  • Images in the size of 1440x440px or the same width/height format seems to be a good size to use in this component.
  • Avoid using images that contains a lot of white color as this will blend in with the content and the user might not differ the picture from the rounded mask or the overlapping content.
  • Images of nature and people are easier to match with this component than portrait images.

examples.name: FullWidthImage (default)
FullWidthImage - With mask

examples.html:
If you add the --with-content-overlap CSS class then the next piece of content will overlap the image.

It's recommended to wrap the overlapping content in a <div class="container"> to make it responsive and <section class="container--small"> to give the content a max-width to restrict the line length in the text for readability (accessibility) reasons.

If you also specify the container--extra-padding-top CSS class the container will be padded on top. This is solved with a modifier class because not all elements within the main-content element should have padding on top.

If you specify the container--overlapping-full-width-image CSS class the overlapping content will look the same on smaller devices until it wraps beneath the image on the smallest devices.

Add main-content--bg-color-white if you want the background-color to be white.

It's also recommended to keep the height of the next piece of content tall enough to cover the mask.
examples.name: FullWidthImage - With overlapping-content

src\\components\\molecules\\FunkyTabs\\F.documentation:
Status: finished.

The FunkyTabs component are implemented as a list, where each tab is a list element with a link inside. The link has a href; <a href="">, with the intention that the href also is a part of the URL.

When a new tab is clicked, the content in the panel associated with the tab should be displayed, and the URL changes to indicate to the user that he/she are looking at some new content.

examples.html:
• Under 15 år
  • Under 28 år
  • For alle
  • Kontantkort
This is the Funky Tabs component which consists of four tabs and four panels. Each tab contains a link with an image and a text, and this link controls the associated panel's visibility.
This is the Funky Tabs component which consists of four tabs and four panels. Each tab contains a link with an image and a text, and this link controls the associated panel's visibility.

If you add the --with-content-overlap CSS class then the next piece of content, such as this Focus Box, will overlap the header.

When using the header with --with-content-overlap it is recommended to use a component like Focus Box as the next component on the page.

This is recommended to keep the overlapping content tall enough to cover the mask.

src\\components\\molecules\\Hero\\Hero.h.documentation:
Status: finished.

The hero component requires two images, one for desktop and one for mobile view. With using the <picture> element this component itself decides when to load and render appropriate image for specific viewport.

Image recommendations from designers:

  • Images in the size of 1440x620px or the same width/height format seems to be a good size to use in this component.
  • Avoid using images that contains a lot of white color as this will blend in with the content and the user might not differ the picture from the rounded mask or the overlapping content.
  • Images of nature and people are easier to match with this component than portrait images.

The Hero image has a max-height of 620px, and when the width of the browser is bigger than 1440px the image is center aligned and gets cropped from both the top and bottom by default. If you want the image to be top aligned use the css modifier class .hero__image--top-aligned on the image-element instead. If you want it to be bottom-aligned use .hero__image--bottom-aligned.

The heading in the white box should span a maximum of two lines and the sentence below should span a maximum of two lines.

You can add pebbles to the page by adding .hero--with-pebbles. If you want the pebbles only on desktop or mobile you can in addition add .hero--with-pebbles-only-on-mobile or .hero--with-pebbles-only-on-desktop. Choose between different variation of pebbles by adding .hero--with-pebbles-variant-1 (number 1-4 exists). There is also one for black friday .hero--with-pebbles-black-friday and one for easter .hero--with-pebbles-easter.

examples.html:
A heading for this Hero

And this is the subheading
examples.name: Hero (default)

examples.html:

The image is bottom aligned, seen when browser is bigger than 1440px.
